newsitem.title: UK: J.Fisher completes rights issue for ship buy.
newsitem.headline: J.Fisher completes rights issue for ship buy.

text.p: British specialist tankship operator James Fisher and Sons Plc said on Monday it had received valid acceptances totalling about 94.2 percent of the 24 million shares offered at 120p under a recent rights issue.
The company said in a statement that stockbrokers Panmure Gordon had found further subscribers for the remaining shares, at a premium price of 135 pence per share.

The deal had been intended to raise some 27.4 million stg net for James Fisher so that it could proceed with the purchase of a petroleum product tanker operating company from Peninsular and Oriental Steam Navigation Co Plc (P&O).
"We are delighted with the response to the rights issue and look forward to progress in 1997 for the enlarged group," company executive chairman David Cobb said in a statement.
